subject: Programming
title: The Knight Capital Glitch
description: A quick win: understand The Knight Capital Glitch.

hook.text: On August 1, 2012, Knight Capital lost $440 million in just 45 minutes.

buildup.text: A technician deployed new trading code but forgot to update it on one of eight servers.

discovery.text: The old code on that server started buying high and selling low at machine speed.

twist.text: Nobody noticed for 45 minutes. By then, the company was effectively bankrupt.

climax.text: Knight Capital was sold days later. A missed deployment destroyed a billion-dollar firm.

punchline.text: One missed server update killed a company in 45 minutes.

quiz.question: How much did Knight Capital lose due to the software glitch?
